title: Joseph Estrada
summary: Joseph Ejercito Estrada (Tagalog: [ɛhɛɹˈsɪtɔ ɛsˈtɾada], born Jose Marcelo Ejercito; April 19, 1937), also known by the nickname Erap,[1][lower-alpha 2] is a Filipino politician and former actor who served as the 13th president of the Philippines from 1998 to 2001, 9th vice president of the Philippines from 1992 to 1998, and the 21st mayor of the City of Manila, the country's capital,[2] from 2013 to 2019. In 2001, he became the first chief executive in Asia to be formally impeached[3] and resigned from power. He is widely considered to be a kleptocrat.[4][5]
